intro: Siphonodon pyriformis var. parvifolius, commonly known as the small-leaved siphonodon, is a rare variant of the siphonodon plant, characterized by its diminutive, ovate leaves. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is native to specific regions in South America. The plant exhibits a compact growth habit with a dense, bushy appearance. Its leaves are typically a deep green and have a slightly waxy texture. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
